TextView.android:text: Faces the new ball and builds the foundation. Requires excellent technique against pace bowling and patience to see off the new ball threat.
The backbone of batting lineup. Builds partnerships, stabilizes innings, and accelerates when needed. Master of situation management.
Provides quick runs and supports main batsmen. Often aggressive players who can change game momentum with explosive batting.
Raw pace and aggression. Uses speed, bounce, and intimidation to dismiss batsmen. The spearhead of pace attack.
Masters of swing and seam. Uses movement, accuracy, and variations rather than raw pace to trouble batsmen.
Natural angle creates challenges for left-handed batsmen
Provides variation with natural angle to right-handed batsmen
Finger spin from off to leg for right-handed batsmen
Wrist spin with googlies and variations
Left-arm finger spinner with natural variation
Rare left-arm wrist spinner with unique action
Strong batsman who can contribute with the ball. Provides batting depth and bowling options to the captain.
Primary bowler who can bat competently. Strengthens the bowling attack while adding batting depth.
Elite player equally skilled in both batting and bowling. Can win matches with either skill. Extremely valuable to any team.
